Name: Manganese N,N'-ethylenebis(dithiocarbamate)
Rationale for classification: Assigned to Division 4.2 and Packing Group III (UN#2210 Maneb or Maneb Preparations with not less than 60% maneb, self-heating substance (ICSC (2003))) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

Name: Carbon black
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Category 1-2(Materials of animal or vegetable origin), Classification not possible(Materials of mineral origin)
Rationale for classification:
It is based on the Animals-and-plants system materials: UN number 1361 (CARBON, animal or vegetable origin, Class4.2, Packing Group IIorIII).
Mineral systems materials: data without.

Name: chlorophenol
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Classification not possible (o, m, p-)
Rationale for classification:
The test suitable for a liquid state substance is not established. (o-body)
The test suitable for a solids material is not established. (Solid with a melting point of 140 degC or less)   (m-body, p-body)

Name: Formaldehyde
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Not applicable (gas) Classification not possible (aqueous solution)
Rationale for classification: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition (gas). Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (aqueous solution)

Name: Polychlorinated terphenyls
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Classification not possible (liquid or solid with melting point of <=140degC), Not classified (melting point of >140degC)
Rationale for classification: Test methods applicable to liquid or solid substances with melting point of <=140degC are not available (test temperature: 140degC), whereas those with melting point of >140degC cannot be classified due to lack of data. Classified into Class 9 (UN#3151 (Polyhalogenated Biphenyls (liquid; excluding polychlorinated biphenyls (UN#2315, liquid); those with concentrations of not more than 50mg/kg are not included in the Dangerous Goods list), or Polyhalogenated Terphenyls (liquid; those with concentrations of not more than 50mg/kg are not included in the Dangerous Goods list)), UN#3152 (Polyhalogenated Biphenyls (solid; excluding polychlorinated biphenyls (UN#3432, solid); those with concentrations of not more than 50mg/kg are not included in the Dangerous Goods list), or Polyhalogenated Terphenyls (solid; those with concentrations of not more than 50mg/kg are not included in the Dangerous Goods list)) by the UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, which is "Not classified."

Name: Arsenic acid
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Classification not possible (aqueous solution)
Rationale for classification: Arsenic acid is present only in aqueous solutions. Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

Name: Celluloid, in blocks, rods, rolls, sheets, tubes, etc.
Hazard statement: Self-heating in large quantities; may catch fire

Name: Poly(oxyethylene) octylphenyl ether
Classification: Self-heating substances and mixtures - Classification not possible (when 9 moles of ethylene oxide added)
Rationale for classification: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (when 9 moles of ethylene oxide added)
